trg_text: 1987 Dakar Talks is commemorated Visit to South Africa by Indonesian delegation Cabinet welcomes the visit to South Africa by Sultan Husain Abubakar Syah of Tidore in Indonesi The Tidore delegation included Muhammad Amin Farouk, a descendant of Tuan Guru, a freedom fighter who was captured by the Dutch and sent to Robben Island in 1780.

src_text: irelet a le go t wet a pele ditshenyegelo t a leago ka thutong, ka maphelong, mananeokgoparareng a motheo le ka t hirelet egong ya t a leago, yeo maAfrika Borwa a mant i a e botilego go ipshina ka bophelo bjo bokaon Ka seemong sa dit helete seo se sa kgahli ego, boikgafo bja mmu o bja go fihlelela ditlhohlo ka Afrika Borwa bo laet wa ke ditsenogare t a go godi a diekonomi t a makhei eneng le t a dinagamagaeng, go maatlafat a pu o e kaone ka dikhamphani t a mmu o, gammogo le kabo ya tlalelet o ye bohlokwa ya thu o ya dit helete go thuto ya godingwan Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa ka moka go tsenela masolo ao a oket egilego a go godi a ekonomi Diphati i o t a Dipalo t a Ba omi Kabinete e leboga Diphati i o t a Dipalo t a Ba omi t a Kotara ka kotara t eo di sa t wago go lokolwa ka ga t a kotara ya boraro ya 2017, t eo di laedit ego gore tlhokego ya me omo e t wet epele go se fetoge go tloga kotareng ye e fetilego ka 2.
trg_text: In a constrained fiscal space, government s commitment to meet challenges in South Africa is demonstrated by interventions to grow township and rural economies, strengthen good governance at state-owned companies, as well as the additional significant allocation of funding higher educatio Cabinet calls on all South Africans to join increased efforts to grow the economy Labour Force Survey Cabinet appreciates the recently released Quarterly Labour Force Survey for the third quarter of 2017, which showed that unemployment remained unchanged from the previous quarter at 2.

src_text: Mmu o o t wela pele go ikgafa go dira se sengwe le se sengwe seo se kgonagalago go rarolla mathata a tlhokego ya me omo ebile o ipilet a go lefapha la phraebete go raloka karolo ya lona Moketeko wa mengwaga ye lekgolo ya Oliver Reginald Tambo Kabinete e leboga maAfrika Borwa ka moka ge a ketekile mengwaga ye lekgolo ya mogale wa Ntwa ya tokologo OR Tambo, yeo e feleledit ego ka moketeko wo o swerwego ka Labohlano la 27 Diphalane 2017 ka Motseng wa Nkantolo ka Kapa Bohlabel Bjalo ka karolo ya meketeko ya ngwagakgolo, Mopresidente Jacob Zuma o etile pele diprot eke t a kaonafat o, go akaret wa: Go fana semmu o ka Letamo la Ludeke ka Mbizana, leo le agilwego bjalo ka karolo ya Setlamo sa Kabo ya Meetse a Selete sa Greater Mbizana ke Kgoro ya Meetse le Kelelat hila;Ketelo ya ka lapeng la ga Nyameni ka Motseng wa Ludeke fao Mopresidente a gotedit ego mohlagase, bjalo ka karolo ya lenaneokakaret o la mmu o la go tsenya mohlagase dinagamagaeng ka Mbizana le dinagamabapi;Dipaesekele di filwe baithuti ka Sekolong seo se Phagamego sa t a Bothekniki sa OR Tamb, bjalo ka karolo ya lenaneo la Shova Kalula la Kgoro ya Dinamelwa, leo le thu ago baithuti bao ba sepelago dikhilometara t e di fetago t e tharo go ya sekolong; Kabo ya dikhomphutha go baithuti ka Sekolong seo se Kgethegilego sa Vukuzenzele go bana bao ba nago le bogolofadi, yeo e bego e etilwe pele ke Tona ya Dikgokagano, Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane Dipalopalo ka ga Bosenyi Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa ka moka le dit haba go diri ana le ditheo t a phethagat o ya molao go lwant ha boseny Dipalopalo ka ga Bosenyi t e di lokollot wego mo nakong ye e sa t wago go feta ke Tona ya Maphodisa, Morena Fikile Mbalula, di laedit e makala ao go ona re bilego le kgatelopele ya go lwant ha bosenyi le makala a mangwe ao go ona maemo a bosenyi a ganelelago go ba godim Kabinete e na le bonnete bja gore ke fela ka go
trg_text: The employment gains recorded in the formal sector of 187 000 over the quarter, the informal sector and agriculture sector recorded employment losses of 71 000 and 25 000 respectivel Government remains committed to doing everything possible to deal with the unemployment challenges and calls on the private sector to do their part Centenary of Oliver Reginald Tambo Cabinet thanks all South Africans for celebrating the centenary of Struggle stalwart OR Tambo, which culminated in celebration on the Friday, 27 October 2017 at Nkantolo Village in the Eastern Cap As part of the centenary celebrations, President Jacob Zuma officiated over improvement projects, including:The hand-over of the Ludeke Dam in Mbizana, which was built as part of the Greater Mbizana Regional Bulk Water Supply Scheme by the Department of Water and Sanitation;A visit to the Nyameni family in Ludeke Village where the President switched on electricity, as part of the broader government rural electrification programme in Mbizana and surrounding areas;Bicycles distributed to learners at OR Tambo Technical High School, as part of the Department of Transport s Shova Kalula programme, which supports learners who walk more than three kilometres to school;The donation of computers to learners in the Vukuzenzele Special School for children with disabilities, led by the Minister of Communications, Mmamoloko Kubayi-Nguban 4.

src_text: Kabinete e ipilet a gape go badudi go rutana ka ga ditokelo t a basadi le bana, le ka ga mekgwa ya mehutahuta thu o ye e lego gona go thu a bat wasehlabelo ba dikgarur Lesolo la Mat at i a 16 Kgahlanong le Dikgaruru go Basadi le Bana ke lesolo la Mokgatlo wa Dinagakopano (UN), leo le swarwago ngwaga o mongwe le o mongwe go tloga ka la 25 Dibatsela (Let at i la Bodit habat haba la Phedi o ya Dikgaruru kgahlanong le Basadi) go fihla ka la 10 Manthole (Let at i la Bodit habat haba la Ditokelo t a Botho).
trg_text: Cabinet also calls on citizens to educate one another on the rights of women and children, and on the various recourse mechanisms that exist to help victims of violenc The 16 Days of Activism Campaign is a United Nations (UN) campaign, which takes place annually from 25 November (International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women) to 10 December (International Human Rights Day).

trg_text: South Africa and Senegal exchanged views on critical regional and global issues and signed agreements in several area The two countries enjoy cordial bilateral political, economic and social relations underpinned by strong historical ties dating back to the years of the liberation struggl The signing of a Memorandum of Understanding on the twinning of Robben Island (used by the racist apartheid regime to incarcerate freedom fighters) and Gor e Islands (the route through which African people were shipped out for a life of slavery) further cements our countries

src_text: omi wa ke mmu o wa peleng wa kgethologanyo go golegela balwelatokologo) le Gor e Islands (tsela yeo batho ba Afrika ba ilego ba rwalwa ka dikepe go i wa bokgobeng) go t wela pele go tii a dikamano t a rena t a set o le t a histori ge Dipoledi ano t a ka Dakar t a 1987 di ketekwa Ketelo ya Afrika Borwa ke Baemedi ba Indonesia Kabinete e amogela ketelo ya ka Afrika Borwa ke Mmu i wa Mamoselemo Husain Abubakar Syah wa Tidore ka Indonesi Baemedi ba ba go t wa Tidore ba akaredit e Muhammad Amin Farouk, setlogolo sa Tuan Guru, molwelatokologo yo a ilego a golegwa ke Matoit he gomme a romelwa Robben Island ka 1780.
trg_text: The delegation visited the National Assembly and the National Council of Provinces where they were welcomed by the presiding officers, Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa and Economic Development Minister Ebrahim Pate The visit highlighted the common history of colonial rule and the centuries-old fight for national liberation by the people of Indonesia and South Afric Today we celebrate trade, tourism and other economic links between the two countries End-of-year examinations Cabinet is satisfied that the end-of-year examinations currently taking place at schools and other learning institutions are going ahead unhindere Education is one of the key drivers towards a better future for all in the countr Parents and guardians are urged to continue to give the necessary support to learners during this perio The Department of Basic Education s catch-up programmes and other initiatives have assisted learners affected by protests during the year and a positive outcome is expecte Social cohesion1 Cabinet commends the law-enforcement agencies and the collaboration from the communities who helped secure the conviction of Willem Oosthuizen and Theo Jackso The two forced Victor Mlotshwa into a coffin and threatened to pour petrol on himThe judgement demonstrates that South African laws are firm in protecting the rights of all citizen 1

src_text: Tuan Guru (Imam Abdullah bin Qadi Abdussalam) le magagabo a mangwe a mararo ba ile ba golegwa mengwaga ye 12 gomme ka morago ga fao ba bewa bot habelo ka Kapa, fao a ilego a tsenya letsogo kudu go hlabolla set haba sa tikologo le go aga moseke wa mathom MaAfrika Borwa a mmalwa a lati i a ba malapa a bona go yen Baromiwa ba ba etet e Kopanokgothekgothe ya Maloko a Palamente ka moka le Lekgotla la Boset haba la Diprofense fao ba ilego ba amogelwa ke bahlankedi ba tshepedi o, Motlat amopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa le Tona ya Tlhabollo ya Ekonomi Ebrahim Pate Ketelo ye e ahlaahlile histori ye e swanago ya dinaga t e mabapi le pu o ya bokoloniale le ntwa ya mengwaga e makgolo ya go lwela tokologo ya set haba ke batho ba Indonesia le ba Afrika Borw Lehono re keteka dikamano t a kgwebi ano, t a boeti le t e dingwe t a ekonomi gareng ga dinaga t e ka bobedi Ditlhahlobo t a mafelelo a ngwaga Kabinete e kgotsofet e ge ditlhahlobo t a mafelelo a ngwaga t e di kgatlampanago mo lebakeng le ka dikolong le ka dihlongweng t e dingwe t a thuto di t wela pele ntle le t hiti

src_text: irelet a ditokelo t a badudi ka mokaKabinete e t wela pele go tii et a ditokelo t a maAfrika Borwa ka moka t a go tsenela dit hupet o t e di nago le khut o bjalo ka karolo ya temokrasi ya rena ya molaothe Le ge go le bjale, ditokelo t eo di hlalo it wego ka gare ga Molaotheo wa Repabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa 1996 ga se t eo di hlokago mellwane gomme ga se t a swanela go gataka ditokelo t a temokrasi t a ba bangweKabinete e kgalema go thibja ga ditsela t a set haba, go laet a maswao a kgatelelo ye e fetilego le go senywa ga maswao a boset haba ao a lego taet o ya temokrasi ya rena ye e fihlelet wego gaboimaKabinete e ikgafile go mo omo wa yona wa go aga set haba seo se diri anago sa bohle gomme e ipilet a go badudi ka moka go raloka tema ya bona le ka moya wa go
trg_text: Cabinet further affirms the right of all South Africans to engage in peaceful protest as part of our constitutional democrac However, rights prescribed in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 are not absolute and must not infringe on the democratic rights of othersCabinet condemns the blocking of public roads, displaying of symbols of past oppression and destruction of national symbols which are a reflection of our hard-earned democracyCabinet is committed to its role to build a cohesive society for all and calls on all citizens to play their part responsibly and in the spirit of working together to build a united, non-racist, non-sexist, democratic and prosperous South Afric Cabinet Decisions1 Cabinet approved the 2015/16 Report on State of Local Government in South Afric

src_text: omi ana go aga Afrika Borwa ye e kopanego, ya go hloka semorafe, ya go hloka kgethologanyo ya bong, ya temokrasi le ye e atlegileg Diphetho t a Kabinete1 Kabinete e dumelet e Pego ya 2015/16 ka ga Seemo sa Mebu oselegae ka Afrika Borw Pego ye e ahlaahla kgatelopele ye e fihlelet wego ka go tsenya tiri ong ga Lenaneo la Re Boela Morago go Metheo (B2B), e lego leanotiro la go netefat a kabo ya ditirelo t a motheo, pu o e kaone le taolo ya dit helete ye e kwagalagPego ye e ahlaahla mafapha ao a nago le ditlhohlo ebile e fana ka motheo wa go tsenya tiri ong ga kgato ya bobedi ya Lenaneo la B2 Pego ye e tla alwa ka PalamentengKabinete e thekgile dipheto o t e di
trg_text: The proposed amendments have been canvassed with the relevant stakeholder All the amended sector codes will be gazettedCabinet approved the National e-Strategy and its publication in the Government Gazett It was published in April 2017 for public comment The e-strategy articulates a shared vision and paradigm shift from information society to a knowledge economy and societIt addresses challenges, including a digital divide between the rich and poor, between racial groups, different geographical locations and gender issueIt provides a platform for South Africans to integrate technology, which is relevant and related towards advancing development and economic prosperity for the benefit of society as a whol The Department of Telecommunications and Postal Services will provide more information on this strategyCabinet approved the National e-Government Strategy and Roadmap, to be published in the Government Gazett It will bring digital transformation to the public services and enable the provision of improved quality of services whilst tapping into digital technologie The strategy targets, amongst others, fragmentation of e-government initiatives and duplication of processes, databases, large-scale system incompatibilities and inefficiencie It will also increase the usage of information and communications technology (ICTs), foster innovation in technologies and applications for e-GovernmentCabinet approved the ICT Small, Medium and Micro-sized Enterprises (SMME) Development Strateg This is a sector-specific intervention to address challenges facing SMMEs operating in the ICT sectoThe strategy proposes interventions to accelerate the development and growth of small enterprises in the ICT sector, while facilitating an increase in the levels of uptake and usage of ICTs by the general small business sectoThe strategy aims to support start-up ICT enterprises, strengthen existing enterprises and extend support to potentially viable SMMEsCabinet approved the publication of the Report on the Evaluation of the National School Nutrition Programm This a government programme with an annual budget of Rbillion resulting in nine million children from poor communities receiving a daily nutritious meal at schoo The report provides areas of effective implementation and some areas that need improvemenThe report will be made available on the website of the Department of Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation (wwdpmgoza) Cabinet supports South Africa s standing for re-election to the two-year membership of the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) Counci These elections will be held during the 30th Regular Session of the Assembly from 27 November to 6 December 2017 in London, United KingdoSouth Africa is a maritime nation with close to 80% of international trade done by se South Africa s membership in the IMO Council contributes to employment growth derived from the Operation Phakisa: Oceans EconomyCabinet approved the introduction to Parliament the ratification of the Amendment to the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer to include hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs).

trg_text: Upcoming eventsCabinet also acknowledged some of the upcoming events in the government calenda Presidential Siyahlola Monitoring Programme1 President Zuma is scheduled to visit the Steve Biko Academic Hospital in Tshwane on Friday, 3 November 2017 to monitor the delivery of healthcare services as part of the Presidential Siyahlola Monitoring ProgrammThe hospital is one of the best performing public hospitals in the country and is named after Steve Bantu Biko, the late liberation struggle hero and former medical student at the then University of Natal (now called University of KwaZulu-Natal).President Zuma s visit is part of the ongoing government monitoring programme that aims to address challenges facing public hospitals and to improve the healthcare system in the country, which is one of government s key prioritie

trg_text: land reform initiatives As part of promoting the use of ICTs to build an inclusive economy, Cabinet approved the iKamva National e-Skills Institute Bill of 2017 (iNeSI Bill) to be gazetted for public consultation and commenThe iNeSI Bill provides for the establishment of iNeSI as a public entity with its own enabling legislation, to address the e-skills shortage that hinders investment, socio-economic development and capacity development in the countrThis will establish ICT production hubs in each province, which will then assist iNeSI to develop and design relevant programs and training material, promote and undertake innovative research, and provide research capacity to postgraduate studentsCabinet approved the publication of the Postal Services Amendment Bill in the Government Gazette for public commen This amends the Postal Services Amendment Act N 124 of 1998.The Bill provides for the restructuring of the postal sector in general to contribute to the provisions of universal access to innovative e-services while continuing to provide quality and secure traditional postal serviceThis contributes to equality and human dignity through access to information and affordable postal services, which facilitate social development and improve the quality of life for individuals and communitie

src_text: omago gabotse le ka ga mafapha ao a hlokago go kaonafat wPego ye e tla dirwa gore e hwet agale wepsaeteng ya Kgoro ya Peakanyo, Tlhokomedi i o le Tshekatsheko ya Phethagat o ya Mo omo (wwdpmgoza)abinete e thekga lesolo la Afrika Borwa la nkgetheng leswa ka go boleloko bja mengwaga ye mebedi bja Lekgotla la Mokgatlo wa Bodit habat haba la t a Mawatle (IMO).
trg_text: This amends the Local Government: Municipal Structures Act, 1998 (Act 117 of 1998).The Bill seeks to strengthen intergovernmental and democratic governance arrangement It also seeks to address issues around the administration and management of municipal elections, and to promote the effective and efficient implementation of the Act, as well as to strengthen oversight and governance in municipalitiesCabinet approved for the submission to Parliament of the Electronic Deeds Registration Systems Bill of 2017.
